channel.title: mattkorus.com
channel.description: The personal website of Matt Korus

item.title: Let's see where this leads
item.content:encoded:
Let's see where this leads

December 17th, 2023

My initial goal here is to create a website using Swift and as much SwiftUI as possible. I only began learning Swift, and really programming at this level, in 2023. So, this will be a learning experience. This is to say that nothing here is going to be a recommendation. I’m going to make a bunch of mistakes, and even when I feel I’m crushing I’m sure many people will feel otherwise.

Right now I’m going to write into text files and save them locally. I will hopefully advance past this at some point. I have a domain, but no web hosting setup yet. So this will see the light of day later on, if ever.

Each time I learn something new, or more likely, fail miserably, I’ll do my best to create a new entry here. As of today, what you're reading is all of the progress I've made. None.

Here’s to the hope of an eventual Swift powered blogging platform,

-Matt

item.title: Initial Progress is Made
item.content:encoded:
Initial Progress is Made

December 18th, 2023

Last night, I discovered Publish (https://github.com/JohnSundell/Publish). I've read quite a bit on the Swift by Sundell site, but hadn't realized that a Swift tool was used in making it. It seems this will make my whole journey a lot shorter here.

I now have a site that I can run locally, so there's a start. Shoutout to Danijela Vrzan for danijelavrzan.com and an easy to follow getting started guide.

I already own mattkorus.com - I'll have to get this set up over there next.

-Matt
